Key Match Events: Dyson Daniels hit a 3-pointer during the Hawks' 126-111 win over the New Orleans Pelicans at the Smoothie King Center on Sunday.
Dyson Daniels made a gesture that looked like he was shooting a gun after hitting a 3-pointer, which he later clarified was just to indicate the shot was worth 3 points.
Daniels had 16 points and five rebounds in the Hawks’ win.
Post-Match Reflections: Daniels, who spent his first two seasons with the Pelicans before being traded to the Hawks, said he was just having fun and wanted to let the Pelicans' bench know about the 3-pointer.
Daniels mentioned that the game was one he had circled on his calendar.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win for Atlanta snapped a four-game losing skid and moved them to 3-4 on the season.
The NBA has fined players for similar gestures in the past, but it’s unclear if Daniels will be penalized.
